hi and welcome you listening to the x-22

Report and you can play the interview

understand that Venezuela defaulted and
then as well as collapsing right now and
we know they're making a deal with
Russia they're restructuring the loans
but we need to understand that Venezuela
is connected to other nations and
they're at risk also I mean we look at
Lebanon Lebanon is one of the most
world's indebted countries Lebanon may
hit a debt to gross domestic product
where she of about a hundred fifty two
hundred fifty two percent this year and
this is cording to the IMF and we can
see right now that Lebanon right now is
they're using this for a proxy type of

look at these nations Ecuador after a
borrowing spree the nation's debt
obligation over the next 12 months
balloon to a nine-year high relative to
its GDP we look at Ukraine and we
understand what happened in Ukraine they
are defaulting they are in a huge amount

billion in debt right now and we see
that the country is still struggling to

default swaps are hovering near the
highest in September the cost for
protection surged in June as regional
tensions heated up
we also see Pakistan Baja rain Turkey
all these nations right now are
connected and if Venezuela goes down or
something happens as a Black Swan it's
going to affect these nations and these
nations are going to affect other
nations and it's going to be a domino
effect we see that the corporate media
out there is trying to make it look like
that the consumer debt problem is really
not a problem here in the United States
and we talked about how people are
living off credit cards we understand
the global debt problem and they're
saying that yes there's a lot of debt
out there but according to the reports
it doesn't seem that the this type of
debt is going to slow the economy or
hurt the economy just yet but they're
saying there are cracks forming and this
is their way of saying that there isn't
really a debt problem remember the
central banking system they don't like
to talk bad about the central bank the
Fed this is their product debt they
don't want debt to make they don't want
debt to seem bad they don't want it they
don't they don't want debt to look make
it look like the economy is doing poorly
because of the debt problem because if
this is true then all the central banks
around the world who have been loaning
their currency out with interest well
they're out of business so they can't
allow this to happen but what's very
interesting is that the ECB and other
central banks they're looking to maybe
get rid of the deposit protection scheme
and what they're saying is that the
covered depositing claims under investor
compensation schemes should be replaced
by limited discretionary exemptions to
be granted by the competent authority in
order to retain a degree of flexibility
now to translate all this what the ECB
is saying is they wanted to get rid they
want to get rid of the deposit level
right now which protects individuals
with about a hundred thousand euros so
if the bank goes belly-up you have the
insurance and you get your money back
and they don't want this because what
the reasoning they're using
is that they're saying that because of
this protection like the FDIC the
insurance where it protects you against
a bank failing they're saying the
insurance makes it so people will go in
and take their money out and there might
be a bank run on these banks that are
failing which makes no sense to me
because if it's insured by the
government you wouldn't really see a
bank run I mean people if they hear a
bank is failing they're gonna go in and
take their funds out anyhow what I think
they're doing right now is they're
preparing for this next crisis they
understand that most of these banks are
completely insolvent especially in
Europe here in the United States too but
Europe is a complete and utter disaster
and I think what they're doing right now
is they realize that their insurance
that they have set up right now will not
cover the number of banks that will be
going down and they came out with this
ECB paper it was published on November
8th 2017 entitled on revisions to the
Union crisis management framework and
the balance
they are basically reworking the beylin
documentation to get rid of the
insurance part of it and we can see that
it looks like they are preparing for the
next crisis because they understand when
this crisis hit people and they've seen

in all different countries to see how
people are going to react to certain
things they saw in Greece when they
heard you know they were going to be
balanced banks might be shut down they
ran to the banks they took out their
currency it happened in Italy it
happened in Spain and they're using this

people think that they have to go and

to me whatsoever they're trying to cover
themselves the central banking system is
trying to cover themselves because they
know when these banks go belly-up they
know that the insurance will not cover
any of this here in the United States we
know there's not enough of
the FDIC insurance to cover the number
of banks that will flow yes if one two
or three banks fail they might have
enough to cover those bangs if ten fail
it's completely impossible they will not
be able to do it
and we see at this point they
implemented the FDIC insurance and other
insurance around the world after the
depression to build the confidence back
up so people would say hey I can put my
money in the bank it's insured
I don't have to worry if the bank fails
I will not lose my money because that's
what happened during the Great
Depression and now they want to get rid
of it because the crisis is too big they
can't control the size of this crisis
and this is why you need to be ready and
prepared and we've been talking about
balance for quite a while this is when
the bank goes in and actually takes your
currency and gives you worthless stock
of that bank that is failing and then
they create this bank holiday they put
restrictions on how much you can take
out of your own funds and all of a
sudden your money is trapped inside of
the bank that is a balun a bailout is
when the government uses taxpayer money
to give it to these financial
institutions to bail out whatever they

this point that governments right now
well they're not doing the bailout thing
so the banks had to come up with some
other idea and this is why they had
created the bail in documents they

running to these banks to try to get

real
writing everything and they're preparing
